remarks: Like ~ prarloclemarch but the integer must be at least two, and there is also ` B ` added to the right hand side.  These details follow straightforwardly but are chosen to be helpful in the proof of ~ prarloc .  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 25-Nov-2019.)
statement:
prarloclemarch2 $p |- ( ( A e. Q. /\ B e. Q. /\ C e. Q. ) -> E. x e. N. ( 1o <N x /\ A <Q ( B +Q ( [ <. x , 1o >. ] ~Q .Q C ) ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d C x $.
